text: The John Lair House and Stables, at the northeast corner of U.S. Route 25 and Hummel Rd. in Renfro Valley, Kentucky, was built in 1944. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1995. The listing included two contributing buildings. Its conceptual design was by John Lair; the architect was Wayne W. Haffler. With . ==See also== *John Lair House, near Shawhan, Kentucky, listed on the National Register in 1983 ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Kentucky Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1944 Category:Rockcastle County, Kentucky
title: John Lair House and Stables
